website_summaries.verdict: While this machine isn't practical for all users, it's a good pick for those who typically work with tough, thick materials.
pros: Boasts a very powerful motor that can sew through heavy fabrics like canvas and many types of leather
Has 10 practical stitch options and is easy to use
cons: Doesn't have a lot of fancy stitches or extra features

customer_reviews.title: work horse power house
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine to make decoy bags, ammo boxes, tote bags and other sporting equipment. The first thing I did was try sewing heavy-duty canvas. I kept doubling the fabric until it was to thick to go under the presser foot. It sewed through 12 layers of canvas as if it was sewing a single layer!!! I've sewed canvas, leather, plastic, foam and cardboard without a hick-up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: what a work horse
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine I make masks for the homeless and migrant workers. I have made over 1200. If it wasn't for this power house, these people who needed the most would not have them I burn out two machines before I brought the work horse. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Adler

customer_reviews.title: Just look over the manual before you start using the machine
customer_reviews.text: I got this machine to do car upholstery. The machine handle the material very well. The one thing I found frustrating was winding the bobbin. Maybe it’s me but eventually I figured it out .
customer_reviews.author: susan hermenet

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase! My mom loves it. Amazing quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: leticia marin

customer_reviews.title: I make bags and pockets and was disappointed when sewing curves on the leather
customer_reviews.text: Noisy, however sew through several layers of heavy weight fabric. Problem with sewing medium to heavy weight leather. I make bags and pockets and was disappointed when sewing curves on the leather, the thread would skip sometime. I bought this machine to replace an older Singer machine that was given to me by my mother. I'm satisfied but not excited. It's a good home machine.
customer_reviews.author: lharris21

customer_reviews.title: We have found them to be good machines at an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: Our theatre department utilizes these machine with our students. We have found them to be good machines at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Mancuso

customer_reviews.title: Singer CG-550 10-Stitch Commercial Grade Sewing Machine
customer_reviews.text: I just love this sewing machine. I started sewing again after 20 years and was totaly frustrated with out of date sewing machines. I just finished sewing some heavy burlap and it did wonderful. When I do sew, I sew for hours and this machine can handle heavy sewing. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Singer
customer_reviews.text: Well what can I say other than it,s a Singer Commercial Grade. It does what it says it will do, however I needed something more, like sewing leather. Other than that it,s ok.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: 2 strikes and it's out
customer_reviews.text: First one received - the needle hit something in the base and locked-up. We notified Amazon and they quickly had the vendor contact us for a replacement. Second one received - the needle made a cycle then jammed in the base and locked-up the motor. That's enough for me, have again notified Amazon and am asking for return and refund. PS I have sewn for over 50 years on all types of machines. I had 2 other people with similar experience test this machine with identical results - so, this is not operator error. I think I will search for a Husqvarna Viking machine.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Campbell Jr.

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: searching for a new one now. This machine is not for people that wants to do heavy duty sewing. All the issues that others are talking about is true. My frustration with this machine is countless!
customer_reviews.author: Latasha

customer_reviews.title: reliable
customer_reviews.text: works great! never had a problem with it :) i use it for quilting and find it works great even over the batting!
customer_reviews.author: hlhs mama

customer_reviews.title: Good, without all the bells and whistles.
customer_reviews.text: No fancy stitches, no lights and buttons. This is a good manual machine for dressmaking to upholstery home goods etc, noisy but strong, however the CG 590 is a sturdier model for outdoors/sports equipment or leather sewing, without going for an industrial machine. 3 stars because it is noisy, heavy and price is also a bit too high for a manual SInger.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing

customer_reviews.title: We sew 5-6 hours a day and the machines work great! They are not really commercial but they do ...
customer_reviews.text: This machine is a workhorse! I have a small business and I have pruchased about 6 of these machines over the years. We sew 5-6 hours a day and the machines work great! They are not really commercial but they do outperform a home machine, especially if you want to sew thorugh THICK layers. For a small business like mine they are inexpensive and work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Romatex

customer_reviews.title: sold something that was broken
customer_reviews.text: didn't get to use it right away, When I did take it out the bobbin would get all jammed up with tread, found out the bobbin was miss aligned. That means someone tried to jam material through it. not pleased. they knew this when they sold it . I bought it used.
customer_reviews.author: Dove R. Johnson

product_meta.title: Singer CG-550 10-Stitch Commercial Grade Sewing Machine
product_meta.description: CG 550 Heavy Duty Sewing Machine with a 60% stronger-than-average motor
